Backtest Engine¶

class finmarketpy.backtest.backtestengine.Backtest¶

Conducts backtest for strategies trading assets. Assumes we have an input of total returns. Reports historical return statistics and returns time series.

backtest_output()¶
calculate_diagnostic_trading_PnL(asset_a_df, signal_df, further_df=[], further_df_labels=[])¶

Calculates P&L table which can be used for debugging purposes,

The table is populated with asset, signal and further dataframes provided by the user, can be used to check signalling methodology. It does not apply parameters such as transaction costs, vol adjusment and so on. Returns DataFrame with asset, trading signals and returns of the trading strategy for diagnostic purposes

asset_a_df: DataFrame

Asset prices

signal_df: DataFrame

Trade signals (typically +1, -1, 0 etc)

further_df: DataFrame

Further dataframes user wishes to output in the diagnostic output (typically inputs for the signals)

further_df_labels

Labels to append to the further dataframes

calculate_exposures(portfolio_signal)¶

Calculates time series for the total longs, short, net and absolute exposure on an aggregated portfolio basis. Returns DataFrame (list)

portfolio_signal: DataFrame

Signals for each asset in the portfolio after all weighting, portfolio & signal level volatility adjustments

calculate_trading_PnL(br, asset_a_df, signal_df, contract_value_df, run_in_parallel)¶

Calculates P&L of a trading strategy and statistics to be retrieved later

Calculates the P&L for each asset/signal combination and also for the finally strategy applying appropriate weighting in the portfolio, depending on predefined parameters, for example:

static weighting for each asset static weighting for each asset + vol weighting for each asset static weighting for each asset + vol weighting for each asset + vol weighting for the portfolio

br: BacktestRequest

Parameters for the backtest specifying start date, finish data, transaction costs etc.

asset_a_df: pandas.DataFrame

Asset prices to be traded

signal_df: pandas.DataFrame

Signals for the trading strategy

contract_value_df: pandas.DataFrame

Daily size of contracts

components_pnl()¶

Gets P&L returns of all the individual subcomponents of the model (after portfolio level leverage is applied)

pandas.Dataframe

components_pnl_cum()¶

Gets P&L as a cumulative time series of individual assets (after portfolio level leverage adjustments)

pandas.DataFrame

components_pnl_desc()¶

Gets P&L of individual components as return statistics in a string format

str

components_pnl_ret_stats()¶

Gets P&L return statistics of individual strategies as class to be queried

TimeSeriesDesc

components_pnl_trades()¶

Gets P&L of each individual trade per signal

pandas.Dataframe

create_portfolio_weights(br, _pnl, method='mean')¶

Calculates P&L of a trading strategy and statistics to be retrieved later

brBacktestRequest

Parameters for the backtest specifying start date, finish data, transaction costs etc.

_pnlpandas.DataFrame

Contains the daily P&L for the portfolio

methodString

‘mean’ - assumes equal weighting for each signal ‘weighted’ - can use predefined user weights (eg. if we assign weighting of 1, 1, 0.5, for three signals the third signal will have a weighting of half versus the others)

weightsdict

Portfolio weights

pandas.DataFrame

Contains the portfolio weights

individual_leverage()¶

Gets leverage for each asset historically

pandas.DataFrame

pnl()¶

Gets P&L returns of all the individual sub_components of the model (before any portfolio level leverage is applied)

pandas.Dataframe

pnl_cum()¶

Gets P&L as a cumulative time series of individual assets

pandas.DataFrame

pnl_desc()¶

Gets P&L return statistics in a string format

str

pnl_ret_stats()¶

Gets P&L return statistics of individual strategies as class to be queried

TimeSeriesDesc

pnl_trades()¶

Gets P&L of each individual trade per signal

pandas.Dataframe

portfolio_cum()¶

Gets P&L as a cumulative time series of portfolio

pandas.DataFrame

portfolio_leverage()¶

Gets the leverage for the portfolio

pandas.DataFrame

portfolio_net_exposure()¶

Gets the total net exposure of the portfolio

DataFrame

portfolio_net_exposure_notional()¶

Gets the total net exposure of the portfolio scaled by notional

DataFrame

portfolio_pnl()¶

Gets portfolio returns in raw form (ie. not indexed into cumulative form)

pandas.DataFrame

portfolio_pnl_desc()¶

Gets P&L return statistics of portfolio as string

pandas.DataFrame

portfolio_pnl_ret_stats()¶

Gets P&L return statistics of portfolio as class to be queried

RetStats

portfolio_signal()¶

Gets the signals (with individual leverage & portfolio leverage) for each asset, which equates to what we would trade in practice

DataFrame

portfolio_signal_contracts()¶

Gets the signals (with individual leverage & portfolio leverage) for each asset, which equates to what we would have a positions in practice, scaled by a notional amount and into contract sizes (eg. for futures) which we need to specify in another dataframe

DataFrame

portfolio_signal_notional()¶

Gets the signals (with individual leverage & portfolio leverage) for each asset, which equates to what we would have a positions in practice, scaled by a notional amount we have already specified

DataFrame

portfolio_total_exposure()¶

Gets the total absolute exposure of the portfolio

DataFrame

portfolio_total_exposure_notional()¶

Gets the total absolute exposure of the portfolio scaled by notional

DataFrame

portfolio_total_longs()¶

Gets the total long exposure in the portfolio

DataFrame

portfolio_total_longs_notional()¶

Gets the total long exposure in the portfolio scaled by notional

DataFrame

portfolio_total_shorts()¶

Gets the total short exposure in the portfolio

DataFrame

portfolio_total_shorts_notional()¶

Gets the total short exposure in the portfolio scaled by notional

DataFrame

portfolio_trade()¶

Gets the trades (with individual leverage & portfolio leverage) for each asset, which we’d need to execute

DataFrame

portfolio_trade_contracts()¶

Gets the trades (with individual leverage & portfolio leverage) for each asset, which we’d need to execute, scaled by a notional amount we have already specified and into contract sizes (eg. for futures) which we need to specify in another dataframe

DataFrame

portfolio_trade_no()¶

Gets number of trades for each signal in the backtest (after both signal and portfolio level vol adjustment)

pandas.Dataframe

portfolio_trade_notional()¶

Gets the trades (with individual leverage & portfolio leverage) for each asset, which we’d need to execute, scaled by a notional amount we have already specified

DataFrame

portfolio_trade_notional_sizes()¶

Gets the number of trades (with individual leverage & portfolio leverage) for each asset, which we’d need to execute, scaled by a notional amount we have already specified

DataFrame

signal()¶

Gets signal for each asset (with individual leverage, but excluding portfolio leverage constraints) for each asset

pandas.DataFrame

trade_no()¶

Gets number of trades for each signal in the backtest (before

pandas.Dataframe

class finmarketpy.backtest.backtestengine.PortfolioModel¶
class finmarketpy.backtest.backtestengine.RiskEngine¶

Adjusts signal weighting according to risk constraints (volatility targeting and position limit constraints)

calculate_leverage_factor(returns_df, vol_target, vol_max_leverage, vol_periods=60, vol_obs_in_year=252, vol_rebalance_freq='BM', resample_freq=None, resample_type='mean', returns=True, period_shift=0)¶

Calculates the time series of leverage for a specified vol target

returns_dfDataFrame

Asset returns

vol_targetfloat

vol target for assets

vol_max_leveragefloat

maximum leverage allowed

vol_periodsint

number of periods to calculate volatility

vol_obs_in_yearint

number of observations in the year

vol_rebalance_freqstr

how often to rebalance

resample_typestr

do we need to resample the underlying data first? (eg. have we got intraday data?)

returnsboolean

is this returns time series or prices?

period_shiftint

should we delay the signal by a number of periods?

pandas.Dataframe

calculate_position_clip_adjustment(portfolio_net_exposure, portfolio_total_exposure, br)¶

Calculate the leverage adjustment that needs to be made in the portfolio such that either the net exposure or the absolute exposure fits within predefined limits

portfolio_net_exposureDataFrame

Net exposure of the whole portfolio

portfolio_total_exposureDataFrame

Absolute exposure of the whole portfolio

brBacktestRequest

Includes parameters for setting position limits

DataFrame

calculate_vol_adjusted_index_from_prices(prices_df, br)¶

Adjusts an index of prices for a vol target

brBacktestRequest

Parameters for the backtest specifying start date, finish data, transaction costs etc.

asset_a_dfpandas.DataFrame

Asset prices to be traded

pandas.Dataframe containing vol adjusted index

calculate_vol_adjusted_returns(returns_df, br, returns=True)¶

Adjusts returns for a vol target

brBacktestRequest

Parameters for the backtest specifying start date, finish data, transaction costs etc.

returns_a_dfpandas.DataFrame

Asset returns to be traded

pandas.DataFrame

class finmarketpy.backtest.backtestengine.TradingModel¶

Abstract class which wraps around Backtest, providing convenient functions for analaysis. Implement your own subclasses of this for your own strategy. See tradingmodelfxtrend_example.py for a simple implementation of a FX trend following strategy.

Compares the trading strategy we are backtesting against a benchmark

construct_individual_strategy(br, spot_df, spot_df2, asset_df, tech_params, key, contract_value_df, run_in_parallel, compress_output)¶

Combines the signal with asset returns to find the returns of an individual strategy

Parameters for backtest such as start and finish dates

Market time series for generating signals

Parameters for generating signals

abstract construct_signal(spot_df, spot_df2, tech_params, br, run_in_parallel=False)¶

Constructs signal from pre-loaded time series

Parameters for generating signals

Allow signal calculation in parallel

construct_strategy(br=None, run_in_parallel=False)¶

Constructs the returns for all the strategies which have been specified.

It gets backtesting parameters from fill_backtest_request (although these can be overwritten and then market data from fill_assets

brBacktestRequest

Parameters which define the backtest (for example start date, end date, transaction costs etc.

individual_leverage()¶
abstract load_assets(br=None)¶

Loads time series for the assets to be traded and also for data for generating signals. Can overwrite it with our own BacktestRequest.

static load_model(path)¶

Load the pickle of the saved model. :param path: path to pickle. :return: TradingModel instance.

abstract load_parameters(br=None)¶

Fills parameters for the backtest, such as start-end dates, transaction costs etc. To be implemented by subclass. Can overwrite it with our own BacktestRequest.
